articles.title: U.S. Should be Accustomed to Status of DPRK as Nuclear Weapons State
articles.content:
U.S. Should be Accustomed to Status of DPRK as Nuclear Weapons State 
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry issued a statement on Friday in which it said that its first successful H-bomb test was a just measure for self-defense to defend the sovereignty of the country and the right of the nation to live and ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula and regional security.
					 The DPRK is not interested in aggravating the situation as it is channeling all its efforts into the building of an economic power and feels no need to provoke anyone, the statement said, and went on:.
					
					 As the first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK clarified in his New Year Address, its primary task for this year is to develop economy and improve the people's standard of living and to this end it requires stable situation and peaceful climate more than any time.
					
					 As the U.S. hostile acts against the DPRK have become "routine," the latter has also become routine in its work to implement the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts for self-defence to cope with them.
					
					 Now the U.S. should be accustomed to the status of the DPRK as a nuclear weapons state whether it likes or not.
					
					 As the DPRK had already clarified, it will bolster in every way the capabilities for nuclear attack and retaliation to cope with the U.S. ceaseless acts of infringing upon former's sovereignty and perpetrating threatening provocations, but it will not deliberately use nuclear weapons.
					
					 Still valid are all proposals for preserving peace and stability on the peninsula and in Northeast Asia including the ones for ceasing our nuclear test and the conclusion of a peace treaty in return for U.S. halt to joint military exercises.
					
					 It is preposterous for the U.S. to talk about "provocations" from the DPRK though it is persistently sidestepping the latter's fair and aboveboard proposals and escalating the tension.
					
					 It is the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces that are making provocations, rendering the situation extremely tense.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces' resumption of psychological warfare broadcasting is a sheer provocation nothing relevant to the normal process pursuant to the DPRK's line of simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 The U.S. is working hard to bring the dark clouds of a nuclear war by introducing the strategic nuclear strike means into south Korea. The UN, too, is making great haste to fabricate a resolution on sanctions aimed at such hostile acts as hamstringing our efforts for peaceful economic construction and the improvement of the people's standard of living.
					
					 Such provocative and hostile acts against the DPRK will not be confined to escalating the tension on the peninsula but inevitably lead to a war. 
					
					 Once a powder keg catches fire and goes off, the responsibility for it will rest with those who ignited the fuse.

articles.title: Certificates Awarded to Delegates to Events for Celebrating Birthday of Youth League
articles.content:
Certificates Awarded to Delegates to Events for Celebrating Birthday of Youth League 
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Certificates illustrated with the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il were awarded to delegates to the events  for celebrating the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					 A ceremony of awarding the certificates took place at the People's Palace of Culture on January 14.
					
					 Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, made a speech.
					
					 He said that Marshal Kim Jong Un, always deeply concerned for the work with the youth, showed deep loving care for the delegates to the events for celebrating the anniversary.
					
					 He called upon all delegates to firmly uphold and add brilliance to the idea of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on the youth movement and the their leadership feats and fully display the indomitable stamina and revolutionary will of the heroic Korean youths in the struggle for ushering in a golden age in building a thriving nation this year when the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea is to be held with the immense national pride and honor of having brought about the historic event to be specially recorded in the nation's history spanning 5000 years by achieving spectacular success in the H-bomb test.

articles.title: Art Squad of C.C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Gives Performance
articles.content:
Art Squad of C.C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Gives Performance 
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by the art squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League for celebrating its 70th founding anniversary at the Central Youth Hall Friday.
					 The performance started with a prelude and narration "Joy of the People". Put on the stage were such numbers as choral recitation of poem and chorus "Song of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League" and female quintet "Our Dear Marshal".
					
					 They highly praised the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu for always paying deep attention to the youth work, setting a world example in solving the youth issue and building the youth power on this land without parallel in the world.
					
					 Put on the stage were numbers reflecting the spirit of ardent youths to become creators of miracles and youth heroes at the construction sites for building a thriving nation.
					
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, Yang Hyong Sop and officials of the youth league and delegates to the celebrations of the anniversary of the youth league.

articles.title: Brass Band March for Celebrating Anniversary of Youth League Held
articles.content:
Brass Band March for Celebrating Anniversary of Youth League Held
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- There took place a brass band march for celebrating the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League on Friday.
					 The participants in the march gathered at the plaza of the Arch of Triumph and left for Kim Il Sung Square playing band music following a speech made by Jang Hyon Chol, vice-chairman of the C.C., the youth league.
					
					 They marched playing "Song of General Kim Il Sung", "Song of General Kim Jong Il" and "Ode to General Kim Jong Un".
					
					 They also marched to the tunes of songs "Song of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League" and "Might of Korea".
					
					 The march showed well the revolutionary enthusiasm of young vanguard to become creators of miracles and youth heroes at the construction sites for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Schoolchildren Give Performance to Celebrate Youth League Anniversary
articles.content:
Schoolchildren Give Performance to Celebrate Youth League Anniversary
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Schoolchildren Friday gave a performance "We Are the Happiest in the World" at the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace in celebration of the 70th founding anniversary of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League. 
					 Put on the stage were colorful pieces including chorus "Song of Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League," solo and chorus "May My Song Resound forth All Over World" and folk instrumental music and song "Gate to Happiness." 
					
					 Among the audience were Ri Il Hwan, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of the youth league and delegates to the events for celebrating the 70th anniversary of the youth league.

articles.title: Youth Delegates Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Youth Delegates Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The delegates to the events for celebrating the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They laid wreaths and bouquets before the graves of Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik, and the graves of Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok and observed a moment's silence.
					
					 After visiting the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum, they went round historic relics preserved with much care at the old home of the President, being briefed on the revolutionary careers of the President and his family members.
					
					 The visitors also toured the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong where they placed bouquets before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and paid tribute to her before going round the cemetery.
					
					 They laid bouquets at the wreath-laying stand "Soul of Heroes" at the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery and observed a moment's silence before going round the cemetery.
					
					 They also visited the venues of the exhibition of scientific and technological achievements and the art exhibition which were opened on the occasion of the said anniversary.

articles.title: 20th Kimjongilia Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
20th Kimjongilia Festival to Be Held
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The 20th Kimjongilia Festival will be held at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition in Pyongyang from mid-February, Juche 105 (2016) to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 It will bring together armed forces organs, ministries, national institutions, overseas compatriots bodies including the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, people from all walks of life, school youths and children and foreign friends.
					
					 There will take place Kimjongilia shows and Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia greenhouses will be open for visitors in local areas during the festival.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Update Railways
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Update Railways
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The IT Institute under the Ministry of Railways in the DPRK puts spurs to the scientific research for modernization of the country's railways.
					 In recent years its scientists and technicians have made signal achievements conducive to updating the country's railways. They developed the remote control systems for rail butt welder, overhead crane and CNC turning lathe and the geographical information system needed to ensure regular operation of trains.
					
					 They also contributed to the development of subway train, which began its service at the outset of this year.
					
					 According to chief engineer Jong Hyon Chol, the Institute plans to concentrate its efforts on perfecting the transport control information system and putting the factories and enterprises of rail transport sector on a CNC and unmanned basis this year.
					
					 He declared that the Institute would strive to let the rail transport sector take the lead in this year's general offensive by displaying the principle of giving priority to self-development like nuclear scientists and technicians.
					
					 The Institute, founded in February Juche 65 (1976), won the Order of National Flag First Class and the Twice Three-Revolution Red Flag.

articles.title: KCTU Demands Strong Reaction to Fascist Police's Suppression
articles.content:
KCTU Demands Strong Reaction to Fascist Police's Suppression
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held a press conference in Seoul on Jan. 11 to denounce the fascist police for its indiscriminate suppression of the participants in the all-out people's action, according to Newsis of south Korea.
					 Speakers condemned the police for intensifying suppression of the participants in the Nov. 4 all-out people's action last year, intervening even in their private life.
					
					 Those who are put on the list of investigation number more than 1,500, they noted.
					
					 They said they would strongly react to the police's suppression.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Keen on Increasing Military Nexus with Japan
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Keen on Increasing Military Nexus with Japan
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean military warmongers are keen on tightening military nexus with Japan seized by the ambition for reinvading the Korean Peninsula.
					 According to a newspaper of Japan on Jan. 13, warships of the Japan Maritime "Self-Defense Force" and the navy of south Korea staged joint military exercises including communications drill at the Gulf of Aden in the waters off Somalia, Africa on Dec. 23 last year.
					
					 It is an undeniable fact that the south Korean authorities are getting frantic in the moves for a military nexus with Japan, the sworn enemy of the Korean nation.
					
					 The fact fully proves that the present ruling forces of south Korea are working hard to stifle compatriots at any cost by increasing a military nexus with Japan, which its preceding dictators dared not do.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Authorities Intensify Suppression of People's Struggle
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Authorities Intensify Suppression of People's Struggle 
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean fascist police authorities are intensifying suppression of the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps which has struggled for the settlement of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. 
					 The Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency Thursday said it is investigating the above-said council on the charge of violation of the "law on assembly and demonstration". 
					
					 The council has taken the lead in the struggle for forcing Japan to make a state and legitimate responsibility and apology and reparation for the hideous unethical crimes Japan committed since 1992 together with the victims of the sexual slavery.

articles.title: DPRK's First Successful H-bomb Test Hailed by Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
DPRK's First Successful H-bomb Test Hailed by Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan made public a statement on Jan. 8.
					 The statement said that the DPRK succeeded in the H-bomb test, a great deed of history that reliably guaranteed the eternal future of the Korean nation and an event to go down in the national history.
					
					 The H-bomb test is a just measure for self-defense for thoroughly defending the sovereignty of the country and the vital right of the nation and reliably guaranteeing the peace in the Korean Peninsula and security in the region from the nuclear threat and blackmail by the U.S.-led hostile forces, the statement stressed.

articles.title: Italian Personage and South African Party Leader Hail DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test
articles.content:
Italian Personage and South African Party Leader Hail DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Antonio Razzi, secretary general of the Commission for Foreign Affairs of the Senate of Italy, expressed full support for the successful H-bomb test of Juche Korea. 
					 According to the Italian paper Il Centro on January 6, he told reporters that the first H-bomb test conducted by the DPRK was for self-defence and that every country has the right to choose the solution to protecting its own people. 
					
					 He said the most ideal way is dialogue and that he attached importance to dialogue and the DPRK also aspires after it. He stressed the international community hopes to improve the relations with the DPRK and see the sanctions against it lifted. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the chairman of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party sent a message to the DPRK embassy in Pretoria on January 6 warmly hailing the success of the first H-bomb test for protecting the socialist cause and defending the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK's Possession of Nuclear Weapons Is Seen by Pyongyang's Regime as Strategic Necessity: AP
articles.content:
DPRK's Possession of Nuclear Weapons Is Seen by Pyongyang's Regime as Strategic Necessity: AP
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The Associated Press of the U.S. on Jan. 9 made a report of the DPRK's first successful H-bomb test. It went on:
					 As has been the case with every nation that went nuclear, possession of such weapons is seen by the North's regime as a strategic necessity. That's why decades of pleading with and punishing the North simply haven't worked.
					
					 Developing a credible nuclear force is in the long run cheaper for Pyongyang and far more likely to be successful than building and maintaining the massive and highly sophisticated conventional forces that would be needed to deter the United States.
					
					 Pyongyang's self-defense claim is also hardly extraordinary. It has been used by all of the nuclear powers.
					
					 "The Saddam Hussein regime in Iraq and the Gadhafi regime in Libya could not escape the fate of destruction after being deprived of their foundations for nuclear development and giving up nuclear programs of their own accord, yielding to the pressure of the U.S. and the West keen on their regime changes," the Korean Central News Agency said in a commentary.
					
					 If, as North Korea claims, it is trying to defend itself against a nuclear-armed adversary bent on regime change and with which it is actually at war-the 1950-53 Korean War ended in an armistice, not a peace treaty-why should its claim to have a right to possess nuclear weapons be treated any differently from other nuclear powers?

articles.title: Nepali Party Praises Kim Jong Un's New Year Address
articles.content:
Nepali Party Praises Kim Jong Un's New Year Address 
Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (United) adopted a resolution on January 8 in support of the New Year Address made by Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					 The resolution said that his New Year Address serves as a landmark shining in the glorious history of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the DPRK. It went on:
					
					 We fully support his New Year Address reflecting the unshakable faith to keep to the road of Juche to the last for all ages and the will to independently resolve the issues of inter-Korean relations and national reunification, rejecting foreign forces' intervention, as desired by the nation. 
					
					 The Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (United) believes that the WPK and the Korean people will greet the Seventh Congress of the WPK, a historic turning point in accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche, as a congress of victors and glory.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Introduced in Mexico, Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Introduced in Mexico, Nigeria
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Reading sessions on the New Year Address made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un took place in Mexico and Nigeria on January 5 and 7. 
					 Present at the reading sessions were personages of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy and other people. 
					
					 The participants heard his New Year Address and speeches were made. 
					
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, and Ramon Jimenez Lopez, chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, referred to the contents of the statement of the DPRK government on the success made in the first H-bomb test, saying that protecting sovereignty and dignity of a country is a legitimate right of an independent and sovereign state. 
					
					 Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said that Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address called for valuing such agreements common to the nation as the three principles of national reunification and declarations between the north and the south and paving an avenue to improving the inter-Korean relations on the basis of them. 
					
					 He fully supported the proposal for Korea's reunification set forth in the New Year Address.

articles.title: Organizations for Study of Juche Idea Meet in DR Congo
articles.content:
Organizations for Study of Juche Idea Meet in DR Congo
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo and the DR Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association took place in Kinshasa on Jan. 4.
					 Present at the meeting were chairpersons and members of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo and the DR Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association and chiefs of the Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Association for Implementing the Juche Philosophy of DR Congo, Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of University of Kinshasa and the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in DR Congo.
					
					 Exchanged there were achievements and experiences gained at their work for studying and disseminating the Juche idea and activities for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people last year.
					
					 The meeting discussed the plan for increasing the ranks of the followers of the Juche idea, studying and disseminating the Juche idea and conducting more dynamic activities for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people this year when the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea is to be held.

articles.title: DPRK's First Successful H-bomb Test Supported by Ugandan, Myanmar Figures
articles.content:
DPRK's First Successful H-bomb Test Supported by Ugandan, Myanmar Figures
Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Figures of Uganda and Myanmar issued statements on Jan. 8 in support of the first successful H-bomb test of Juche Korea.
					 The chairman of the Ugandan National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea warmly congratulated the DPRK on its first successful H-bomb test under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea and Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK, on behalf of all the Ugandan adherents of the Juche idea.
					
					 The DPRK's successful H-bomb test meant a proud demonstration of validity and vitality of the Juche idea, he said, adding:
					
					 What stunned us was the fact that the recent H-bomb test was conducted entirely by the wisdom, technology and efforts of the DPRK.
					
					 The director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute said that the DPRK proved successful in its H-bomb test and thus remarkably bolstered up its war deterrent and no hostile force dares to provoke it.
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK's successful H-bomb test is a just measure for self-defense for creditably ensuring peace in the Korean Peninsula and regional security.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Supported by Brazilian Political Personage
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Supported by Brazilian Political Personage
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, issued a statement on Jan. 7 in congratulation of the first successful H-bomb test of Juche Korea.
					 He congratulated the Korean people on entering 2016 with pride through its first successful H-bomb test, signally bolstering up the war deterrent of socialist Korea.
					
					 The Korean people demonstrated the validity and vitality of Songun politics through their first successful H-bomb test and dealt a heavy blow at the U.S. strategy to dominate Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 Their recent victory is one of the peace- and justice-loving people of the world struggling for the country's sovereignty and of great significance in ensuring peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and Asia and the rest of the world and in the struggle against imperialism.
					
					 Socialist Korea is the country envied by the world people for its strong national power.
					
					 The Party for Free Motherland of Brazil and the Brazilian people will always stand by the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people.

articles.title: DPRK's First Successful H-bomb Hailed by DR Congolese Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's First Successful H-bomb Hailed by DR Congolese Organizations
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- DR Congolese organizations hailed the first successful H-bomb test of Juche Korea.
					 The Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in DR Congo said in its statement on Jan. 8:
					
					 We congratulate and support the DPRK's first successful H-bomb test.
					
					 The DPRK's H-bomb test is clearly a just measure for self-defense for thoroughly defending the country's sovereignty and national right to existence from the increasing nuclear threat by the hostile forces led by the U.S. and reliably ensuring peace in the Korean Peninsula and regional security.
					
					 The U.S. should halt its moves for stifling the DPRK at once.
					
					 On the same day, the Pupils and Students Federation of DR Congo sent a congratulatory message to the DPRK embassy in Kinshasa. The message said:
					
					 We extend warm congratulations to the DPRK on its successful H-bomb test and sincerely wish the DPRK bigger success in its struggle for smashing the outsiders' moves to stifle it and safeguarding its sovereignty and peace.

articles.title: Ofrecida funcion del grupo central de propaganda artistica juvenile
articles.content:
Ofrecida funcion del grupo central de propaganda artistica juvenil
Pyongyang, 15 de enero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 15 en la Casa Central de la Juventud la funcion del grupo central de propaganda artistica juvenil en celebracion del 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung. 
					En la escena de la funcion iniciada con el preludio y narracion "Jubilo del pueblo" se pusieron la poesia a coro y el coro "Cancion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung", el quinteto femenino "Nuestro querido Mariscal", etc.
					
					Los ejecutantes alabaron las proezas de los grandes hombres sin iguales del monte Paektu quienes durante todo el periodo de la direccion sobre la revolucion, prestaron mucha atencion en las labores juveniles, crearon el modelo mundial de la solucion del problema juvenil y construyeron en este territorio la potencia juvenil no vista en el mundo.
					
					Se presentaron en la escena las piezas que describen el impetu de los jovenes coreanos que estan decididos a hacerse creadores de milagros y heroes en los campos de construccion de un Estado prospero socialista. 
					
					Vieron la funcion Choe Ryong Hae, Yang Hyong Sop, funcionarios de la UJS y delegados a los actos festivos por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la UJS.

articles.title: Marcha de banda de instrumentos de viento por 70o aniversario de fundacion de UJS
articles.content:
Marcha de banda de instrumentos de viento por 70o aniversario de fundacion de UJS
Pyongyang, 15 de enero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 15 la marcha de la banda de los instrumentos de viento por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung.
					Luego de intervencion del vicepresidente del Comite Central de la UJS, Jang Hyon Chol, los participantes partieron de la explanada del Arco de Triunfo hacia la Plaza Kim Il Sung, interpretando las musicas de instrumentos de viento, entre otras, las inmortales canciones revolucionarias "Cancion del General Kim Il Sung", "Cancion del General Kim Jong Il" y "Himno al General Kim Jong Un", "Cancion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung", "La fuerza de Corea", "No sabemos a nadie sino a Usted", "Defenderemos a costa de la vida al General Kim Jong Un".
					
					La marcha demostro bien el entusiasmo revolucionario de los jovenes vanguardistas de hacerse creadores de milagros y heroes juveniles en los campos de la construccion de un Estado prospero.

articles.title: Ofrecida funcion artistica de ninos escolares
articles.content:
Ofrecida funcion artistica de ninos escolares
Pyongyang, 15 de enero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 15 en el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae la funcion artistica de los ninos escolares "No envidiamos nada a nadie en el mundo" por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung.
					Se pusieron en la escena el coro "Cancion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung", el coro "General y los ninos", la musica ligera para el instrumento de percusion "Trote de caballo del Paektu", el baile "Es interesante el campismo de esqui" y otras.
					
					La disfrutaron el jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ri Il Hwan, funcionarios de la UJS y delegados a los actos festivos por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la UJS.

articles.title: Delegados juveniles visitan Mangyongdae y otros lugares
articles.content:
Delegados juveniles visitan Mangyongdae y otros lugares
Pyongyang, 15 de enero (ACNC) -- Los delegados a los actos festivos por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung visitaron Mangyongdae.
					Tras depositar ofrendas y ramos florales ante las tumbas de Kim Po Hyon y Ri Po Ik y las otras de Kim Hyong Jik y Kang Pan Sok, guardaron un momento de silencio.
					
					Luego de visitar el Museo de la Historia Revolucionaria de Mangyongdae, ellos estuvieron en la casa natal del Presidente Kim Il Sung donde vieron los objetivos historicos conservados alli escuchando explicaciones de la historia revolucionaria del Presidente y recordaron la vida revolucionaria de este y sus familiares.
					
					En el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios del Monte Taesong, ellos colocaron ramos de flores ante el busto de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk y guardaron un momento de silencio y recorrieron el lugar.
					
					En el Cementerio de Martires de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, ellos depositaron ramos de flores en la plataforma de ofrendas florales "Espiritu de Heroes", guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los soldados heroicos y pasaron por el cementerio.
					
					Tambien, recorrieron la exposicion de exitos cientifico-tecnicos de jovenes y estudiantes y la exhibicion de bellas artes, inauguradas con motivo del 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la UJS.

articles.title: Se efectuara XX Festival de Kimjongilias
articles.content:
Se efectuara XX Festival de Kimjongilias
Pyongyang, 15 de enero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, tendra lugar el XX Festival de Kimjongilias en Pyongyang a mediados de febrero del 105 (2016) de la Era Juche. 
					En el certamen participaran los organismos de las fuerzas armadas, ministerios y organos centrales, la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon y otras entidades de compatriotas en ultramar, trabajadores de distintos sectores, jovenes y ninos escolares y amigos extranjeros. 
					
					En ese periodo se realizaran en las localidades las exposiciones de las flores inmortales y visitas a los invernaderos de Kimilsungias y Kimjongilias.
